openxlsx2 0.2.0

Open a Microsoft Excel file (xls/xlsx) or an openxlsx Workbook

Source: R/xl_open.R
xl_open.Rd

This function tries to open a Microsoft Excel (xls/xlsx) file or an openxlsx Workbook with the proper application, in a portable manner.

In Windows (c) and Mac (c), it uses system default handlers, given the file type.

In Linux it searches (via which) for available xls/xlsx reader applications (unless options('openxlsx.excelApp') is set to the app bin path), and if it finds anything, sets options('openxlsx.excelApp') to the program chosen by the user via a menu (if many are present, otherwise it will set the only available). Currently searched for apps are Libreoffice/Openoffice (soffice bin), Gnumeric (gnumeric) and Calligra Sheets (calligrasheets).

xl_open(file=NULL)

Arguments

file

path to the Excel (xls/xlsx) file or Workbook object.

Examples

# file example
example(write_data)
#> 
#> wrt_dt> ## See formatting vignette for further examples.
#> wrt_dt> 
#> wrt_dt> ## Options for default styling (These are the defaults)
#> wrt_dt> options("openxlsx2.dateFormat" = "mm/dd/yyyy")
#> 
#> wrt_dt> options("openxlsx2.datetimeFormat" = "yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss")
#> 
#> wrt_dt> options("openxlsx2.numFmt" = NULL)
#> 
#> wrt_dt> #####################################################################################
#> wrt_dt> ## Create Workbook object and add worksheets
#> wrt_dt> wb <- wb_workbook()
#> 
#> wrt_dt> ## Add worksheets
#> wrt_dt> wb$add_worksheet("Cars")
#> 
#> wrt_dt> wb$add_worksheet("Formula")
#> 
#> wrt_dt> x <- mtcars[1:6, ]
#> 
#> wrt_dt> wb$add_data("Cars", x, startCol = 2, startRow = 3, rowNames = TRUE)
#> A Workbook object.
#>  
#> Worksheets:
#>  
#>  Worksheet write order: 1, 2
#> wrt_dt> #####################################################################################
#> wrt_dt> ## Hyperlinks
#> wrt_dt> ## - vectors/columns with class 'hyperlink' are written as hyperlinks'
#> wrt_dt> 
#> wrt_dt> v <- rep("https://CRAN.R-project.org/", 4)
#> 
#> wrt_dt> names(v) <- paste0("Hyperlink", 1:4) # Optional: names will be used as display text
#> 
#> wrt_dt> class(v) <- "hyperlink"
#> 
#> wrt_dt> wb$add_data("Cars", x = v, xy = c("B", 32))
#> A Workbook object.
#>  
#> Worksheets:
#>  
#>  Worksheet write order: 1, 2
#> wrt_dt> #####################################################################################
#> wrt_dt> ## Formulas
#> wrt_dt> ## - vectors/columns with class 'formula' are written as formulas'
#> wrt_dt> 
#> wrt_dt> df <- data.frame(
#> wrt_dt+   x = 1:3, y = 1:3,
#> wrt_dt+   z = paste(paste0("A", 1:3 + 1L), paste0("B", 1:3 + 1L), sep = "+"),
#> wrt_dt+   stringsAsFactors = FALSE
#> wrt_dt+ )
#> 
#> wrt_dt> class(df$z) <- c(class(df$z), "formula")
#> 
#> wrt_dt> wb$add_data(sheet = "Formula", x = df)
#> A Workbook object.
#>  
#> Worksheets:
#>  
#>  Worksheet write order: 1, 2
#> wrt_dt> ###########################################################################
#> wrt_dt> # update cell range and add mtcars
#> wrt_dt> xlsxFile <- system.file("extdata", "inline_str.xlsx", package = "openxlsx2")
#> 
#> wrt_dt> wb2 <- wb_load(xlsxFile)
#>

# xl_open("write_dataExample.xlsx")

# (not yet saved) Workbook example
wb <- wb_workbook()
x <- mtcars[1:6, ]
wb$add_worksheet("Cars")
wb$add_data("Cars", x, startCol = 2, startRow = 3, rowNames = TRUE)
#> A Workbook object.
#>  
#> Worksheets:
#>  
#>  Worksheet write order: 1
xl_open(wb)
#> NULL
